column4: I have a folder set as 766. and I can't create a folder inside it with Archive Manager! Why is that?
You the owner of the folder?
How do I find out? I don't think so though... its /var/www/
Usually when I'm working in /var/www on my boxes, I'll either run 'gksudo nautilus' to edit as root, or if I'm in a terminal, I'll do a 'sudo -i' first.
........ I can't say that it's the approved method of working in the webroot folder, but it is better than a chmod -R 777 to it for sure.
you have tried a simple php page to see if apache processes it?
Yeah, its actually a setup sctript for phpmyadmin... But it still prompt to download it.
try sticking this in your index.html file :  <?php_info();?>   refresh and see if you see a bunch of php info
That is extremely weird. Well, thanks... I will test some more stuff.
No worries.  If I may, Navicat has worked well as a replacement for phpmyadmin for me.
An alternative if you can't get phpmyadmin working.
